articles.title: Trading Day: Resisting renewed tariff tensions
articles.description: Global markets remained resilient despite U.S. President Donald Trump's announcement of a 30% tariff on most EU and Mexican imports starting August 1. European and Mexican markets showed minor declines, but broader investor sentiment held strong, with world equity indices rising and the Nasdaq reaching new highs.

articles.title: World news of the day: 14 July, 2025
articles.description: A roundup of major global news events, including the EU delaying retaliatory tariffs against the US, the US sending Patriot missiles to Ukraine, and Jannik Sinner becoming the first Italian to win a Wimbledon singles title.

articles.title: 5 things to know for July 14: Immigration, Gaza, Epstein files, Kentucky shooting, Texas flooding
articles.description: Key news highlights including inhumane conditions at a Florida immigration detention center, an Israeli strike killing children in Gaza, and a shooting spree in Lexington, Kentucky, leaving two dead and three injured.
